RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 73. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by managem ent to run this raceover the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DECLARATION TIME was off the pace to mid turn then moved up on the inside to slip through at the top of the stretch and cruised home. CHIEF REIDER pressed the pace from the two path then took the lead in mid turn but was overtaken at the top of the stretch, weakened but was able to save the place. RUNAHOLIC was away alertly, settled off the pace from three wide, made a late run in the stretch and missed the place. VINDICATO trailed the field to the turn then moved up from two wide, tipped out to four wide in upper stretch to make a rally but was too late. URMIZZENTHEPOINT was forwardly place in the two path through the turn but failed to menace. UNION REWARD saved ground while racing near the back but never made a bid. ALMOND CIDER was roused to the front to take the lead to mid turn and slowly faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Union Reward
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, near back, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Vindicato
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, 2wturn, 4wupper, rallied, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Declaration Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, slipped thru, cruised

ENTRY.NAME: Almond Cider
ENTRY.COMMENT: roused to lead, slow fade

ENTRY.NAME: Chief Reider
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, led mid turn, overtaken, weakened, saved 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Urmizzenthepoint
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Runaholic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, off pace 3w, late run, missed place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Lebanon Valley S. PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1 1/16M Turf CR: 98. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD, RESTRICTED TO HORSES THAT STARTED AT PENN NATIONAL IN 2023 AND HAVE NOT WON A STAKES RACE IN 2023. No Nomination Fee. $250 to pass the entry box, $250 to Start. Supplemental Nominations of $1,000 will be accepted at time of entry which shall include all fees. The purse to be distributed; $500 to horses finishing 6th through last place; with the balance of the purse to be divided, 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three Ye ar Olds, 122 lbs., Older, 124 lbs. This race will be limited to ten (10) horses. Preference to horses with the highest earnings in 2023. Closed Wednesday, August 2, 2023 with 21 nominations. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over thet urf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YOU MUST CHILL raced in the middle of the pack around the first turn then steadily advanced from three wide down the backstretch and took command midway through the final turn, drew off into the stretch and held off the late closer. CRISPER was allowed to settle around the first turn while saving ground, moved off the rail down the backstretch and steadily advanced through the final turn then made a mid track rally to be up for the place. LACCO AMENO was off slow and trailed the field around the first turn while saving ground through the final turn, made a rail bid in upper stretch and angled out to two wide at the eighth pole and held on for the show. WILL E SUTTON was allowed to settle around the first turn, saved ground around the final turn and tipped out to four wide into the stretch and made a late rally but just missed the show. P H FACTOR pressed the pace from the two path around the first turn then inherited the lead after a quarter and edged away but was caught midway through the final turn and gave way. ROBBY'S RANSOM stalked the pace to the final turn and weakened. STRAWBERRY TREAT tracked the leaders around the first turn then retreated. FAMISHED pressed the pace from the inside around the first turn then appeared to take a bad step, pulled up and vanned off. TRUE SUCCESS raced near the back around the first turn then clipped heels with injured rival, stumbled, lost rider and walked off. A STEWARDS INQUIRY WAS POSTED INTO THE RUNNING ON THE BACKSTRETCH, AFTER A REVIEW NO ACTION WAS TAKEN. ALSO TURF WAS LISTED AS FIRM ON THE TV BUT AFTER WATCHING THE REPLAY OF THIS RACE, CHANGED THE TURF CONDITION TO SOFT.

ENTRY.NAME: Crisper
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Will E Sutton
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, 4wrally, missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Lacco Ameno
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, saved ground, rail bid, 2w1/8, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Famished
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, bad step, pulled up, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: P H Factor
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Hara, Jr., Robert and Gower, Gwyneth
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, inherit lead, caught, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: True Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, clipped heels, stumbled, lost rider, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Strawberry Treat
ENTRY.OWNER: Z and Z Stables and Barrett Judith M
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: You Must Chill
ENTRY.OWNER: Kernan Jr Morris E Yo Berbs Racing and Jagger Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, steady advance, took command, drew off, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Robby's Ransom
ENTRY.OWNER: Fountain Springs Stable and DeSales 85 LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Fort Indiantown Gap S. PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 85. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD, RESTRICTED TO HORSES THAT STARTED AT PENN NATIONAL IN 2023 AND HAVE NOT WON A STAKES RACE IN 2023. No Nomination Fee. $250 to pass the entry box, $250 to Start. Supplemental Nominations of $1,000 will be accepted at time of entry which shall include all fees. The purse to be distributed; $500 to horses finishing 6th through last place; with the balance of the purse to be divided, 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth . Weights: Three Year Olds, 122 lbs., Older, 124 lbs. This race will be limited to ten (10) horses. Preference to horses with the highest earnings in 2023. Closed Wednesday, August, 2, 2023 with 22 nominations. (If deemed inadvisable by management to ru n this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERFECT HIDEAWAY was roused to the front to take the lead and held that position to the final turn, headed at the quarter pole and match strides with outside rivals in a stretch battle but she dug in and fought gamely to prevail. WINGS OF A SONG hustled along to prompt the pace from the two path through the final turn, moved to engage the leader nearing the quarter pole and fought gamely down the stretch and was second best. FOXY JUNIOR was close up off the pace to the final turn on the inside then moved out to three wide at the quarter pole to engage the leader at the top of the stretch, fought gamely but was no match for the winner. ONE MORE KELLY was allowed to settle on the inside through the final turn but failed to menace. SIDESWIPED raced near the back around the first turn then made a mild bid down the backstretch but failed to sustain that bid. GAMESTONKS trailed the field to midway down the backstretch and passed tiring rival. ELEGANT TASTE was last away and rushed up from three wide around the first turn but was through after a half, dropped back and galloped in.

ENTRY.NAME: Sideswiped
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, mild bid, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Gamestonks
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: One More Kelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Foxy Junior
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up, off pace, 3w1/4, engaged leader, gamely, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Elegant Taste
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, rushed up, dropped back, gallop in

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Hideaway
ENTRY.OWNER: McClay Thomas G Sweigart Dennis and Cullari Salvatore
ENTRY.COMMENT: roused to lead, headed 1/4, duel stretch, dug in, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Wings of a Song
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, engaged 1/4, stretch duel, gamely

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 99. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEE JAY rushed up to prompt the pace through the final turn then ran down the leader in the stretch to take the lead in the final sixteenth and cleared late. DR. STEVE sprinted away from the gate to take a clear lead through the final turn but was collared in the final sixteenth and gave way grudgingly. SALTO DE TIGRE trailed the field around the first turn to the half mile marked then move up from between horses at the three furlong marker, tipped in at the top of the stretch to make a rail bid and finished evenly but held on for the show. MIDNIGHT ACT was allowed to settle down the backstretch then was coaxed to make a bid from four wide nearing the three furlong marker and kept on to go between horses at the eighth pole but was not enough. EAGLES CRY stalked the pace from three wide in the second flight then edged away on the final turn but failed to sustain that bid. RUBY BLEU tracked the leader in the second flight from between horses to the thee furlong maker and gave way. MAKE IT BIG was off the pace on the inside in the second flight to the three furlong marker and dropped back.

ENTRY.NAME: Dr. Steve
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrone Stephen E Kimball Dan and Spendolini John
ENTRY.COMMENT: sprint away, clear lead, collared 1/16, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Salto de Tigre
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, between 3/8, rail bid stretch, finished evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Make It Big
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 2nd flight inside, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Act
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4w3/8, between 1/8, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Ruby Bleu
ENTRY.OWNER: Premier Stable and Brown Jr Donald L
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, 2nd flight between, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Eagles Cry
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, edged away, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Dee Jay
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, prompt pace, ran down leader, cleared late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Fabulous Strike S. PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 88. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD, RESTRICTED TO HORSES THAT STARTED AT PENN NATIONAL IN 2023 AND HAVE NOT WON A STAKES RACE IN 2023. No Nomination Fee. $250 to pass the entry box, $250 to Start. Supplemental Nominations of $1,000 will be accepted at time of entry which shall include all fees. The purse to be distributed; $500 to horses finishing 6th through last place; with the balance of the purse to be divided, 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three Ye ar Olds, 122 lbs., Older, 124 lbs. This race will be limited to ten (10) horses. Preference to horses with the highest earnings in 2023. Closed Wednesday, August 2, 2023 with 11 nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE MORE SCOOP chased the leader through the final turn then dug in to run down the leader in the stretch to be up in the final jumps. DOWNTOWNCHALYBROWN was away alertly to sprint to a clear lead and set all the pace but was nailed in the final jumps. TRENDING UP raced near the back down the backstretch then went two wide around the turn but was no match for the top two. TUCKERTON BAY trailed and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Tuckerton Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Trending Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, 2wturn, no match top two

ENTRY.NAME: One More Scoop
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leader, ran down leader, up final jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Downtownchalybrown
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, sprinted clear, set pace, nailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Penn Ladies Dash S. PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 91. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD, RESTRICTED TO HORSES THAT STARTED AT PENN NATIONAL IN 2023 AND HAVE NOT WON A STAKES RACE IN 2023. No Nomination Fee. $250 to pass the entry box, $250 to Start. Supplemental Nominations of $1,000 will be accepted at time of entry which shall include all fees. The purse to be distributed; $500 to horses finishing 6th through last place; with the balance of the purse to be divided, 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth . Weights: Three Year Olds, 122 lbs., Older, 124 lbs. This race will be limited to ten (10) horses. Preference to horses with the highest earnings in 2023. Closed Wednesday, August 2,2023 with 13 nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIMPLY STATED prompted the pace from the two path to the quarter pole then engaged the leader to have a stretch battle, she dug in to prevail. EMPIRE PASS rushed to a clear lead to the quarter pole and dueled inside of rival down the stretch while fighting gamely and proved second best. KNICKERSINATWIST was close off the pace in the two path but was shuffled back at the half mile marker, made a rebid on the turn from the inside then angled out to three wide in the stretch but was no match for the dueling duo and was best of the rest. BELLA PRIMA was off the pace while racing three wide then dropped back at the three furlong marker and flattened out. EARLY FROST trailed the field and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Simply Stated
ENTRY.OWNER: W M T Stable and Sylmar Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, engaged leader 1/4, dueled, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Knickersinatwist
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable Jackson Stephen G and Jackson Debbie
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up, shuffled back 1/2, rebid, no match dueling duo

ENTRY.NAME: Empire Pass
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, stretch duel, gamely, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Bella Prima
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, dropped back, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Early Frost
ENTRY.OWNER: IBB Thoroughbred and Stem Brandon Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, outrun,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 94. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 22000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $25,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EGOT A POKER FACE shared the command from the two path to the three furlong marker then edged away on the turn but was challenged in the stretch by two outside rivals, he fended off the challenge and just lasted. PREDOMINATE trailed the field but was close to the pace down the backstretch then was asked and moved up from four wide at the three furlong marker, tipped in to three wide at the quarter pole to make a late rally, fought gamely down the stretch and just missed. THISTLE rushed up to be off the pace from three wide throughout, moved up going into the stretch and fought gamely from between horses but was outfinished by late closing outside rival. SKIMBLE SHANKS was off a step slow, saved ground while racing close up to the pace through the final turn, moved out to two wide in upper stretch and passed a tiring rival. MR JACK shared the command from the inside to the three furlong marker and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: shared command, inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Egot a Poker Face
ENTRY.COMMENT: shared command, edged away, fended, just lasted,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Horseshoe Valley Equine Center LLC & Best Foot Forward, LL

ENTRY.NAME: Skimble Shanks
ENTRY.OWNER: Rock Bottom Ranch and Warrior's Reward LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, saved ground, close up, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Predominate
ENTRY.OWNER: Landis Pamela J and Ciardi Jr Albert A
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, 4w3/8, 3w1/4, rallied gamely, just missed,

ENTRY.NAME: Thistle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, off pace 3w, gamely, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 18. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUSTIN TIME was allowed to settle around the first turn and to midway down the backstretch, made a four wide looming bid at the half mile marker and engaged the leader at the top of the stretch, fought gamely down the stretch and cleared late. SERENE WARRIOR pressed the pace around the first turn from three wide then prompted the pace down the backstretch, took the lead at the five sixteenths pole but was engaged at the top of the stretch by outside rival and fought gamely down the stretch but was out kicked and proved second best. WICKED T had good early speed for the first quarter then settled down the backstretch, was asked at the three furlong marker for a rebid and moved out to four wide at the quarter pole for a late rally. PECAN PATTIE raced in the middle of the pack around the first turn then moved up from between horses at the five furlong marker, kept on and tucked in to save ground around the final turn then tipped back out to five wide in upper stretch but didn't launch a serious bid. SUGAR STREAK was hustled along and went between horses at the seven furlong marker and took the lead at the six furlong marker, inched away down the backstretch, headed at the five sixteenths pole and gave way. ARCTICA raced in the middle of the pack from the two path around the first turn then moved up from three wide at the five furlong marker, dropped back on the final turn and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked T
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, fell back, rebid, 4w1/4, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Pecan Pattie
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, between 5/8, saved ground, 5wupper, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Streak
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, led, inched away, headed 5/16, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Serene Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, prompt pace, brief lead, gamely, out kicked

ENTRY.NAME: Justin Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4w1/2, looming bid, gamely, clrd late

ENTRY.NAME: Arctica
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 2p, 3w5/8, dropped back, no factor,
